description.plain:
One of the most well-known vocalists to come out of the 1970s, singer-songwriter Minnie Riperton stands as a great influential figure for the Soul genre and many artists within this style of music.

Riperton began involving herself with the music industry in 1961 when, as a member of the Chicago-based girl-group The Gems, she worked as a backing vocalist for big artists of the time, such as Etta James. After releasing a few singles under Chess Records, The Gems disbanded, leaving 21-year-old Riperton to continue on as a solo artist, releasing “Lonely Girl” and “You Gave Me Soul” in 1966.

While recording under the alias “Andrea Davis,” she joined the group Rotary Connection as the lead vocalist in 1967, who released fifth full-lengths albums, before disbanding in 1974, giving Riperton the chance to fully invest herself in her solo career.  In 1970, she released her first official album, Come to My Garden, which has since been called a masterpiece and the stepping stone for Riperton’s success. Following this release, she chose to devote her time to her children Marc and Maya Rudolph, and husband Richard Rudolph, in Florida.

During this 3-year period, Riperton was rediscovered by an employee from Epic Records and moved up to Los Angeles with her family to continue with her music career. She began to work for Stevie Wonder as a part of his backing band Wonderlove, joining the group on tour.

With instrumental and production help from both Wonder and her husband, Riperton released her most famed album to date, Perfect Angel, in 1974, which included break-out single “Lovin’ You.” Topping the Billboard Hot 100, the track showcased her five-octave range and her ability to sing in a whistle register.

As her career continued to blossom, Riperton released more albums in the following years, such as Adventures in Paradise, Stay in Love, and her self-titled album Minnie. After the release of  Stay in Love  she was diagnosed with breast cancer, inspiring Riperton to become a spokesperson for the American Cancer Society and the voice of thousands of women that suffered from the illness.

On July 12, 1979, Minnie Riperton passed away at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, Los Angeles, in the arms of her husband. Following this tragic loss, Minnie Riperton’s legacy has continued to live on. Several popular artists have since paid tribute to Riperton by covering her songs, including Ariana Grande, Olivia Newton-John and Chanté Moore.. Riperton’s tracks have also been sampled in songs by well-known rappers such as Jay-Z, Kendrick Lamar and 2Pac.

In addition to being the first artist of her time to demonstrate such ease with singing in the whistle register, Riperton has continued to be an inspiration for many artists to keep fighting on, despite any shortcomings that may come their way.

Riperton began involving herself with the music industry in 1961 when, as a member of the Chicago-based girl-group The Gems, she worked as a backing vocalist for big artists of the time, such as Etta James. After releasing a few singles under Chess Records, The Gems disbanded, leaving 21-year-old Riperton to continue on as a solo artist, releasing “Lonely Girl” and “You Gave Me Soul” in 1966.

While recording under the alias “Andrea Davis,” she joined the group Rotary Connection as the lead vocalist in 1967, who released fifth full-lengths albums, before disbanding in 1974, giving Riperton the chance to fully invest herself in her solo career.  In 1970, she released her first official album, Come to My Garden, which has since been called a masterpiece and the stepping stone for Riperton’s success. Following this release, she chose to devote her time to her children Marc and Maya Rudolph, and husband Richard Rudolph, in Florida.

During this 3-year period, Riperton was rediscovered by an employee from Epic Records and moved up to Los Angeles with her family to continue with her music career. She began to work for Stevie Wonder as a part of his backing band Wonderlove, joining the group on tour.

With instrumental and production help from both Wonder and her husband, Riperton released her most famed album to date, Perfect Angel, in 1974, which included break-out single “Lovin’ You.” Topping the Billboard Hot 100, the track showcased her five-octave range and her ability to sing in a whistle register.

As her career continued to blossom, Riperton released more albums in the following years, such as Adventures in Paradise, Stay in Love, and her self-titled album Minnie. After the release of  Stay in Love  she was diagnosed with breast cancer, inspiring Riperton to become a spokesperson for the American Cancer Society and the voice of thousands of women that suffered from the illness.

On July 12, 1979, Minnie Riperton passed away at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, Los Angeles, in the arms of her husband. Following this tragic loss, Minnie Riperton’s legacy has continued to live on. Several popular artists have since paid tribute to Riperton by covering her songs, including Ariana Grande, Olivia Newton-John and Chanté Moore.. Riperton’s tracks have also been sampled in songs by well-known rappers such as Jay-Z, Kendrick Lamar and 2Pac.

songs.full_title: Lovin' You by Minnie Riperton
songs.title: Lovin’ You

description.plain:
The most well-known song from Minnie Riperton’s album Perfect Angel and her entire discography to date, “Lovin’ You” is a Soul serenade that describes the songstress’ immense love for her child, actress, and comedienne Maya Rudolph. Written by Riperton and her husband Richard Rudolph, “Lovin’ You” was originally meant to be a lullaby for little Maya. Less than a month after its initial release as a single, the song reached #1 on the Billboard Hot 100 and #3 on the Hot R&B/Hip-hop Songs chart.

In a documentary dedicated to the song and the story behind it, Richard Rudolph explained the song-writing process:

We went back home, and we were just sitting around in the house in Florida and I was playing it… she just started to sing, and it just came right out of our lives. But it took over a couple of years, the whole thing from beginning to end.

Since its release more than 40 years ago, “Lovin’ You” has been covered by big names, such as Ariana Grande and Olivia Newton-John, showing the mark that Riperton’s greatest hit has made on other artists in the late 20th and early 21st century.

We went back home, and we were just sitting around in the house in Florida and I was playing it… she just started to sing, and it just came right out of our lives. But it took over a couple of years, the whole thing from beginning to end.

songs.full_title: Les Fleurs by Minnie Riperton
songs.title: Les Fleurs

description.plain:
“Les Fleur” is the first track on Minnie Riperton’s debut album, Come to My Garden. The LP was a commercial failure, but a critical success with appreciation for the album growing with time. Today, it’s regarded by many R&B fans as an out-and-out masterpiece. Charles Stepney, who would later help Earth, Wind and Fire fine-tune their ambitious sound, produced and arranged the album. Come to My Garden itself is genre-defying, spanning soul, gospel, folk, psychedelica, choral music, jazz and more.

For unknown reasons, the record label spelled the song’s title as “Les Fleur,” when the proper French plural would be “Les Fleurs.” Many reissues of the song have issued the proper spelling.

“Les Fleur” was written by Stepney and Riperton’s husband, Richard Rudolph. This song has hippie written all over it— Riperton extols the virtues flower power from multiple perspectives. It’s one of the most popular songs from her debut effort, as well as the title track of this Riperton anthology.

Will somebody wear me to the fair?
(To the morning, sing a lovely flower)
Will a lady pin me in her hair?
(Mmm mmm mmm)
Will a child find me by a stream?
(Gaily laughing in the sunbeam shower)
Kiss my petals, weave me through a dream

For all of these simple things and much more, a flower was born
It blooms to spread love and joy, faith and hope to people forlorn
Inside every man lives the seed of a flower
If he looks within he finds beauty and power

Ring all the bells, sing and tell the people everywhere that the flower has come
Light up the sky with your prayers of gladness and rejoice for the darkness is gone
Throw off your fears, let your heart beat freely at the sign that a new time is born

songs.lyrics:
7 ContributorsMemory Lane Lyrics
I stumbled on this photograph, it kind of made me laugh
It took me way back, back down memory lane
I see the happiness, I see the pain
Where am I? Back down memory lane
I see us standing there, such a happy, happy pair
Love beyond compare, look a-there, look a-there

The way you held me
No one could tell me
That love would die

Why did I have to find this photograph? I thought I had forgot the past
Now I'm slipping fast, back down memory lane
I feel the happiness, I feel the pain
Here am I, back down memory lane
I'm in the sunshine, I'm in the rain
I thought it was over, here I go again


I don't wanna go
Travel up and down
Faster that the speed of sound
Back down memory lane
You steal my foolish heart
Don't let this feeling start
Back down memory lane
I don't wanna go
Back down memory lane
Save me, save me
Back down memory lane
Save me, save me, save me, save me, save me, save me
Back down memory lane
Back down memory lane
Back down memory lane
Back down memory lane
I don't, I know
I know, I don't know, know, know, knowYou might also like2Embed

songs.lyrics:
6 ContributorsReasons Lyrics
The reasons for my life are in a million faces
Like aching promises I feel them in my bones
Slipping through my fingers to dance upon the road
The reasons for my life are more than I can hold

But oh, the sweet delight to sing with all my might
To spark the inner light of wonder burning bright
You're not alone
You're not alone

The reasons for my life are buried in deep places
Words once could awaken them
These seeds that I have sown
Ringing through the madness to crash against the cold
The reasons for my life cannot be bought or sold

But oh, the sweet delight to sing with all my might
To spark the inner light of wonder burning bright
You're not alone
You're not alone

The reasons for my life are filling all my spaces
Like rushing waters flow, they carry me along
Twisting through my memory to pull free from the load
The reasons for my life are more than I was told

To spark the inner light of wonder burning bright

songs.full_title: Perfect Angel by Minnie Riperton
songs.title: Perfect Angel

description.plain:
Perfect Angel was the 6th or 1st song on the B-Side. This is one of the songs Stevie helped produce and written by none other than himself. He revealed in a 1979 Soul Train interview months after this project, he had came up with the melody in 1969 and hadn’t found anyone yet to do the song yet.
Stevie said in his mind he felt that Minnie was the perfect angel which is why he wrote it for her.

songs.embed_content: Read “Perfect Angel” by Minnie Riperton on Genius

Stevie said in his mind he felt that Minnie was the perfect angel which is why he wrote it for her.

songs.full_title: Take a Little Trip by Minnie Riperton
songs.title: Take a Little Trip

description.plain: “Take A Little Trip” is the third song of Minnie’s album Perfect Angel. It deserved way more attention than it got because it has alot of meaning behind this song. Minnie is basically telling every listener to take a little trip through your inner thoughts in your mind. Brainstorm! Be very adventurous. Explore new things. Very positive vibe from Minnie, the deep thinkers should be able to relate to this masterpiece written by Stevie Wonder.

songs.lyrics:
5 ContributorsThe Edge of a Dream Lyrics
The ripples run into the sun
And your smile blends with the clouds that flutter by me
As I sit on the edge of a dream
What do I see? What do I see?
I see the children playing in the sun
And there is love enough for each and everyone
As I sit on the edge of a dream
That's what I see! That's what I see!
Ooh

Things that might be (Things that might be)
If we look we just might see (Just might be)
Paint the world so brightly (So brightly)
Let our freedom ring

Merry-go-round without a sound
I hear your song in the breeze that rock-a-byes me
As I sit on the edge of a dream
What do I see? What do I see?
Mmm, I see the Lord inside of everyone
Can it be my dream will really come?
As I sit on the edge of a dream
That's what I see! That's what I see!
You might also like
Things that might be (Things that might be)
If we look we just might see (Just might be)
Paint the world so brightly (So brightly)
Let our freedom ring

And here comes the morning sun
I wonder if my dream will really come
As I sit on the edge of a dream
That's what I see! That's what I see!Embed

3 ContributorsGive Me Time Lyrics
Seconds pass so very fast
I was watching perfect time
Let me share each day with you
Love you through the sands of time
Time is precious to so few
Love is rare and hard to find
Won't you take this hand of mine
Love can span the hands of time

Yes, time is a treasure that we cannot buy
Time measures a life, and I don't know why
My Love, before I met you I could not give

And you taught me to live

You make my life complete
Give me time to show what you mean to me

I need you to give me time
To show what you mean to me

description.plain: One of the greatest songs Minnie has ever song period, this song is also emotional due to the voice and feeling Minnie delivers. Most of Minnie’s songs told story, this song was a story pay close attention the lyrics.

She is thinking of the year, sixteen
Sixteen
She is taking down her thoughts, reflecting
Expecting
She is musing on her autumn, her dreams
Her dreams
She is making up her mind, expecting
Expecting
She is certain that she likes his schemes
His schemes
She is waiting in the woods, expecting
ExpectingYou might also like1Embed

songs.lyrics:
4 ContributorsClose Your Eyes and Remember Lyrics
Blowing softly through a meadow, laughing like a baby, breeze
(Baby breeze, baby, breeze, baby, breeze)
Tapping lightly at the treetops, whispering among the leaves
(Through the leaves, through the leaves, through the leaves)

You hear the magic song that ancient poets sing, hey, yeah
It's sweet as morning dew, and sounds a lot like springtime

(When you close your eyes) you feel your heart go there
So close your eyes and you may find that
Fireflies were as bright as stars - close your eyes and remember
Summertime lingered on and on - close your eyes and remember
Your first love made the world stand still - close your eyes and remember
Close your eyes and remember
Close your eyes and remember (Remember when...)
The moon was made of cheese

Racing swiftly through the mountains, bubbling along the stream
(Down the stream, down the stream, down the stream)
Sighing sweetly through the hollow, gentle as an infant's dream
(Baby's dream, baby's dream, baby's dream)
